Class TimeScheduler

java.lang.Object
org.example.Domain.TimeScheduler
public class TimeScheduler extends Object
Manages the scheduling of time blocks for operations, storing blocks as Timer objects. Each block represents a segment of time available for scheduling operations.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    TimeScheduler(int blockDurationMinutes)
    Constructs a TimeScheduler with a specified block duration.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description

    Adds a new Timer block to the schedule.
    List<Timer>
    getTimer()
    Returns the current schedule of time blocks.
    int
    timeUntilAvailable(int time)
    Checks the schedule to determine the time until the next available block, starting from a given time.

  • Constructor Details

    • TimeScheduler

      public TimeScheduler(int blockDurationMinutes)
      Constructs a TimeScheduler with a specified block duration. Initializes the schedule with one block of the specified duration.
      Parameters:
      blockDurationMinutes - the duration of each time block in minutes

  • Method Details

    • getTimer

      public List<Timer> getTimer()
      Returns the current schedule of time blocks.
      Returns:
      the list of scheduled Timer blocks

    • addBlock

      public void addBlock(Timer timer)
      Adds a new Timer block to the schedule.
      Parameters:
      timer - the Timer block to add to the schedule

    • timeUntilAvailable

      public int timeUntilAvailable(int time)
      Checks the schedule to determine the time until the next available block, starting from a given time.
      Parameters:
      time - the start time to check for availability
      Returns:
      the time until an available block, or -1 if no availability is found
